messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Chores (A Joke)
messages.msgSnippet: I don t think this is a joke. I think this is the way a lot of people  think. ... So,  there was this guy who always hated doing chores when he was a kid. He
messages.messageBody:
I don't think this is a joke.
I think this is the way a lot of people think.
------------------------------------------------

So, there was this guy who always hated doing chores when he was a kid. He
complained, and said, "I can't wait until I grow up and never have to do
chores."

So he grows up, and it's great. He never does any chores, and one day looks
around and says to himself, "Man, this place is a mess. I gotta get me some

kids."


Kathryn






[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Chores (A Joke)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/15/2005 7:07:27 PM Eastern Standard Time, UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes: Some of  the laziest adults I know were made to do
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/15/2005 7:07:27 PM Eastern Standard Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:

Some of the laziest adults I know were made to do a LOT of chores and heavy

yardwork and wood hauling, etc., when they were kids. And the one who is
THE
most industrious and concerned about his house and yard and car is the one
we used to tease because his mom picked his laundry up and brought it back
folded and put it in his drawers for him.



************************************************
So, there was this guy who always hated doing chores when he was a kid. He
complained, and said, "I can't wait until I grow up and never have to do
chores."

So he grows up, and it's great. He never does any chores, and one day looks
around and says to himself, "Man, this place is a mess. I gotta get me some
kids."


Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
